learning_objectives: Master the core go command line operations and their functions
Identify and understand key packages in the Go standard library
Differentiate between various I/O and networking packages in Go
Understand the mathematical and computational packages available in Go
Recognize system interaction and runtime packages in Go
Comprehend file handling and path manipulation capabilities in Go

key_concepts.definition: Compiles packages named by import paths and their dependencies without installing results
Permits working with modules, introduced in Go 1.11
Enables users to execute test packages and see their results
Contains functions for creating web servers and clients
Saves runtime profiling data for processing by pprof visualization tool
Contains functions for working with numbers with arbitrary precision
Contains functions for working with signals
Contains functions that implement regular expression search

content_summary: The knowledge base covers comprehensive information about the Go programming language's command line operations and its standard library packages, including I/O operations, networking, mathematical functions, system operations, and runtime capabilities.
